revised_title: Potassium Loss in Embryonic Chick Hearts in Potassium-Free Media
tldr: The authors conducted experiments to study the loss of potassium from embryonic chick hearts in potassium-free media with and without calcium. They found that the hearts lose potassium in both cases, but the loss is slower when calcium is present. This research contributes to understanding potassium metabolism and heart function in embryonic development.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Cellular Biology
